course.subject: FINA
course.name: Current Topics in Financial Practices
course.description: This course extends students' knowledge of financial concepts and theories by providing a practical perspective of the operations in financial institutions and the market. In order for students to gain a comprehensive understanding of financial concepts and theories, it is essential for them to understand how the underlying theories are being applied in the field, so they can connect theory to practice. This course also better prepares students for their business career as they gain exposures to updated industry and market practices. The course is taught by industry practitioners and often guest speakers are invited. Topics vary depending on the instructors. The course may be repeated for credits if different topics are taken. Graded P or F.
